name: Greektown on the Danforth Walking Tour
description: Learn about Toronto's Greek community and its settlement on the Danforth during the postwar years. This walk will explore Greektown, from its foundations in faith and family, to milestone community events, and the evolution of businesses and restaurants, including the creation of Flaming Opa Cheese as a tourist spectacle.

name: Aqua's Red Rhythm & Blues

location.name: The Greek Theatre, Guild Park & Gardens

description:
Guild Festival Theatre's summer starts with a special concert, bringing stories of Indigenous hope and resilience through music and dance. Aqua's Red Rhythm & Blues explores themes of resilience in overcoming intergenerational trauma, mental health, addictions, homelessness, and violence. 

As a survivor and warrior, Aqua brings poetry to rhythm with the help of their hand drum. Rooted in their Anishinaabe heritage and accompanied by their Queer guitarist, talented violist, and Indigenous fancy shawl dancer, this group creates space for healing through the soothing sounds of strings and unforgettable harmonies.

name: Toronto Outdoor Picture Show

location.name: Corktown Common at Bayview Ave and Mill St

description:
Look forward to more evening screenings this summer! 

In celebration of our fifteenth anniversary year, the When We Were Young programme reflects on this milestone and what coming of age means. At Corktown Commons enjoy coming of age classics young and old, including Moonlight, Challengers and Speed Sisters, Dazed and Confused, Stand by Me, and What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?

At Christie Pits Park, our original home park, watch films selected for vividly portraying specific moments in time. Films include I Change My Mind, Past Lives, Lady Bird and Flow's Cat. 

As always, attendees are treated to excellent short films by local and Canadian filmmakers paired with each feature. We invite you to lay a blanket in the grass, gaze up at the screen and enjoy a wonderful Toronto summer.

For questions about video and audio accessibility, please visit website.

name: Butterfruit - An Exhibition
description: Using ink and watercolour, this exhibition interrogates the inextricability of botany and identity in the urban-natural interface. The scientific style is re-imagined to illustrate overlooked botanical legacies.

name: Summer Music in the Garden
description:
An intimate live music experience by the waterfront, presenting a multicultural slate of songs, sounds and stories featuring performances by JUNO Award-winning Canadian musicians and celebrated international artists. 

This year's Summer Music in the Garden highlights include the flamenco artistry of Mariana Collado, JUNO and Prix OPUS winning violinist Mark Fewer and Korean traditional music with Ensemble Jeng Yi.
